intro: Gnidia involucrata, commonly known as the Natal wild bean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, bean-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in woodland and grassland habitats, often in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
